column4: Should I expect 7.10 dist-upgrade to fit in 300 megabytes of space?
the file is: 695.8 MB (729608192 bytes)
not talking iso or anything... 4 gigabytes free on /home but the 4 gigabyte / has only 300 megs.
and you don't want to repartition?
preferably not :/
wondering what will happen if I follow the documented upgrade method...
not sure. I still have 7.04 :/
have you tried looking to see how much space it uses right now? in a terminal window (and as root) type : du --max-depth=1 -h /
that will give you a summary of your current directory sizes.
Hmm, looks like no sane way to upgrade except repartitioning... wish I had installed using alt-cd & lvm :/
bummer. :( If it's any consolation I've made some (similar) bad partitioning decisions.
do you have available space in any of the other partitions?
I'll make a policy for myself to never install a non-LVM system again ;)
heh. I made a pact with myself to never try to guess how much to put into 18 different partitions for custom linux installs. :)
have some partitions I can scrap & install clean there
how big are the other partitions?
dunno, the next step is figuring out which fdisk variants actually work... fdisk doesn't.
